page.title: 03Stillingfleet Village
page.content:
The beck running through the village floods when the river Ouse is high. At times up to seventeen houses have been flooded. There is no school in the village, children from five to eleven go to Naburn primary and eleven to sixteen to Fulford comprehensive.
{ There is a Methodist church, with one {service every Sunday, and a Sunday {school. There is also an Anglican {church. The village shop which stocks {from food to shoe laces, is also the {Post Office. A fish & chip van calls {a Thursday, wet fish van once a week, {bread three times and fruit & {vegetables once a week. Milk is {delivered from door to door every day {except Sunday, cream is also carried. {A hairdresser calls by appointment, {and the library van comes once a {week. }
